content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-024-09-B
|Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy.
|Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy.
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the frequency of hypertension
|Description=None
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=Paul Berveiller,Philippe Deruelle
|Order=9}}

High blood pressure during pregnancy affects 5-10% of pregnancies, and of these, 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.

question.title: What percentage of pregnancies are affected by high blood pressure?
question.description: High blood pressure during pregnancy affects a certain percentage of pregnancies, and of these, a certain percentage will develop pre-eclampsia.

option_a.description: High blood pressure during pregnancy affects 20-30% of pregnancies, and of these, 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.

option_b.description: High blood pressure during pregnancy affects 5-10% of pregnancies, and of these, 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.

option_c.description: High blood pressure during pregnancy affects 40-50% of pregnancies, and of these, 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.

option_d.description: High blood pressure during pregnancy affects 80-90% of pregnancies, and of these, 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer
